intro: Bupleurum commelynoideum var. flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellowflowered bupleurum, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
